formats.name: flash_fable
formats.instruction: Invent a micro-fable about a character facing a peculiar dilemma. The lesson should be subtle, not direct. One paragraph only.

formats.name: odd_statistic
formats.instruction: Present a strange, surprising statistic and give your instant reaction in ONE sentence. No explanations or context.

formats.name: multi_voice_argument
formats.instruction: Write a debate between two imaginary characters with opposing views, using dialogue format (each gets 2-3 lines). Capture tension and humor.

formats.name: compressed_history
formats.instruction: Summarize an entire decade or trend in exactly three sentences: what happened, why it mattered, and the weirdest side effect.

formats.name: sensory_experience
formats.instruction: Describe a recent moment using only sensory details (sounds, smells, sights, feels). No opinions or interpretation. Two sentences max.

formats.name: timeline_essay
formats.instruction: Create a chronological account (timeline) of a personal change or discovery, with at least four distinct stages or moments. Each stage gets its own short paragraph.

formats.name: inverse_advice
formats.instruction: Write a piece of advice you DON'T believe in. Explain how following it would actually make things worse. One paragraph.

formats.name: object_story
formats.instruction: Tell the life story of an inanimate object as if it were alive. Make it weird, imaginative, and slightly surreal. Up to two paragraphs.

formats.name: sudden_epiphany
formats.instruction: Describe a moment when an idea hit you unexpectedly. Capture the emotions and immediate effects in under 70 words.

title_styles: Write a title that poses an offbeat question. Examples: 'What if coffee remembered every cup?', 'Is nostalgia just emotional math?'
Create a mysterious, two-part title. Examples: 'Lost keys, found wisdom', 'Glitch in the morning: Lessons from a broken alarm'
Make the title a direct quote from your post, preferably the most memorable line.
Frame the title as a bold claim or prediction. Examples: 'Tomorrow's breakfast will redefine routine', 'Inanimate objects are plotting their comeback'
Invent a metaphor-based title. Examples: 'Life as an overgrown garden', 'Friendships are origami shapes'
structure_variants: Write your post as a sequence of short vignettes, each separated by a line break.
Begin and end with the same sentence, but let the meaning change in between.
Alternate between description and direct questions to the reader.
Use bulleted lists, but every bullet must start with the same word or phrase.
Write your post backwards: start with the conclusion, then give the reasoning or evidence.
topic_angles: How digital tools are changing ancient habits
